title: LBC FOI request - Youth Centres and Youth Services

content:
Global Radio/LBC
4th floor, CBX II East,
Midsummer Boulevard,
Milton Keynes,
MK9 2EA
Dear Sir/Madam,
Under the freedom of information act 2000, I request the following information:
How many youth centres was the council operating each year from the 2010/2011 financial year to end of the 2023/2024 financial year?
How many youth centres operated by councils were closed between 2010/2011 to the end of the 2023/2024 financial year?
How many youth centres previously operated by councils were closed between the start of January 2024 and the end of October 2024?
How many council operated youth centres were open at the end of the 2023/24 financial year?
How many council operated youth centres were open at the end of October 2024?
How much did the council spend on youth services each year between the 2010/11 financial year and end of 2023/24 financial year?
Please can you respond via email to [
email address
]
I would prefer to receive this information electronically, preferably in its original formatting.
If you have any questions please don’t hesitate to contact me via email or phone and I will be happy to clarify what I am asking for and discuss the request.
Thank you.
Kind regards,
Louisa Jackson

Dear Fraser Knight,
Thank you for your request for information relating to youth centres which
we received on 06/11/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
• How many children’s centres and family hubs operated by your council
were closed in the periods 2019/20 - 2022/2023?
• We have had no closures of any Family Centres, now known as Family
Hubs in the time frame requested.
For further information on the Family Hubs, please refer to the Sheffield
Directory:
[1]Family Hubs Overview | Sheffield (sheffielddirectory.org.uk)
• How many youth centres previously operated by your council were closed
in the periods 2019/20 - 2022/2023?
• January 2019 – March 2020 (Sheffield Futures)
No closures
• March 2020 – October 2020 (Sheffield Futures)
All Youth Centre closed temporarily due to pandemic; detached Youth Work
undertaken.
• October 2020 – Present (Sheffield City Council)
Youth Centres reopened from January 2020 on a rolling programme following
National Youth Agency readiness plans in conjunction with Sheffield City
Council facilities management COVID response.
• Effect from pandemic permanent closures –
◦ Tinsley Juniors- staffing resource (September 2021)
◦ Phillimore School- In partnership with school staff – school staff
retired. (April 2021)
◦ Herding’s SEN- consolidated provision with Leos SEN at Centre in
the Park- due to attendance and staffing resource.
◦ Wordsworth Youth Centre – on school site, after COVID school used
as Alternative Provision.
• Venue changes- (all remained in same electoral ward)
◦ Wincobank Youth Centre moved to Wensley Community Centre (November
2022)
◦ Arbourthorne Youth Centre moved to St Leonards Church (October
2023)
• New Youth Clubs created:
◦ Longley (May 2021)
◦ Newfield Green (April 2022)
◦ Firth Park (September 2022)
◦ Stannington (April 2023)
◦ Bramall Lane (June 2023)
◦ Crookes (October 2023)
◦ Jordanthorpe (November 2023)
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
